{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3641064,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-30T18:01:50.250Z","cooked":"

Hello, good afternoon! My team is making a custom joystick board using arduino leonardo and buttons. The board works perfectly, during the teleop. The problems is when a click a button while the teleop is off, when i turn on the teleop, the robot executes the command of button, example:
I press the L4, L3, L2, and L1 button, its execute the L4 command, beause I pressed the L4 first, but when i press only L4, for an example, its execute the L4 too (make the same thing to all commands programed in the robot code)

Sorry for the bad english, im form brazil

Could you share a link to your code? How are you reading data from the button board?

Hi, apologies for the delay! The code is here: 2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java at main · FRC-9485/2025 · GitHub. The comments are in Portuguese Brazil, but the code is inside of the teleopPeriodic, using the “if (joystick.getRawButton(buttonID)) {}”

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-05-30T20:00:19.645Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502601,"topic_slug":"problems-making-a-custom-button-board-like-a-joystick","display_username":"Murilo Miranda Santos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/FRC-9485/2025/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java at main · FRC-9485/2025 · GitHub","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":65568,"username":"therekrab","name":"Nolan Barker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/therekrab/{size}/248500_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/problems-making-a-custom-button-board-like-a-joystick/502601/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641169,"name":"Nolan Barker","username":"therekrab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/therekrab/{size}/248500_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-30T20:06:08.597Z","cooked":"

Here’s what’s going on:

The method getRawButton(buttonID) is what you want. However, your code uses getRawButtonPressed(buttonID), which has a significant difference:

From WPILib documentation:

getRawButton():

This method returns true if the button is being held down at the time that this method is being called.

BUT

getRawButtonPressed():

Whether the button was pressed since the last check.

I see you use getRawButtonPressed() for coral events like L1, L2, L3, and L4. This means that at the start of teleop, the button has been pressed since the last time you checked - even in auton, that counts.

Replace all occurrences of getRawButtonPressed with getRawButton and you should be good to go.
